item.title: Serious trip hazard, 2nd September
item.description:
On the northern pavement there is a sheered off post standing 5 cms high ajoining the kerb. It represents a serious trip hazard to pedestrians

item.title: Bin over flowing and lots of dog bags, 2nd September
item.description:

item.title: 2 abandoned bikes that should have been removed in May, 2nd September
item.description:

item.title: Drysdale Dwellings, 2nd September
item.description:
Rubbish dumped on the pavement in front of the bins at Drysdale Dwellings. Again. Please find a long term solution to this. It’s very dangerous to be forced to walk on the street. And it looks shambolic.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunn Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Mattress dumped on pavement, 2nd September

item.title: Hazelbourne road is a complete mess, 2nd September
item.description:
Multiple households have left bins out on the pavement. Bins are overflowing and or with bags of rubbish dumped next to them on the pavement. It looks a complete mess and is an obvious access and hygiene issue. Worst offenders are at Numbers 87, 67, 61, 31. It’s not acceptable that these households are just leaving their bins out on the pavement and / or flytipping bags of rubbish as well. And as the highway authority, Lambeth has a responsibility to ensure the pavement is free from obstruction

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelbourne Road, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress dumped on landing, 2nd September
item.description:
Mattress has been left on the landing next to the lift. It has been here for the past week. This is a health hazard, please remove as soon as.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Napoleon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tempoary propping of the external facade, 2nd September
item.description:
Due to poorly installed tempoprary popping to the windows on all elevations of the property at 2-3 west Halkin place, vertical timber members are falling from their friction fitted position towards the pavement. Timber ends are jutting into the publlic footpath.There is also a huge amount of fly tipping in the lightwells that is encouraging rodents and potentially a fire hazard.There is also a dead animal within the lightwell .(previously reported but not actioned by wcc)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, West Halkin Street, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped chair, 2nd September
item.description:
Residents have raised concerns regarding the council-installed planters. These installations are attracting the unlawful disposal of rubbish and discarded furniture, resulting in an unsightly and unhygienic environment. Furthermore, the planters have become a focal point for anti-social behaviour, including loitering, public drinking, and excessive noise, which directly impacts the quality of life for those living nearby. The presence of the planters has also led to the inappropriate abandonment of hire bikes, frequently obstructing pedestrian access. In some cases, the bikes have caused damage to residential properties when they are left leaning against, or falling into, windows and housing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Disney Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rta, 2nd September
item.description:
Resident called report there was accident o/s 27 Totnes road and there is glass all over the road and pavement. There is also car been left there which has all the windows smashed and the police have advised caller to notify us to get it removed. Please can we look into this and advise caller with an update.
